title: Ticket #5126: Linux Kernel Tuning Script
description:
As noted in the parent ticket, now that the code to call the script is in place in the master, we need to actually write the script and test it.

Broken out into a different ticket because tickets with multiple fixed versions make our release manager grumpy.
remarks:

Don't forget to turn the script on by default!

Test run 330067 shows the tuning script being present in the RH6 and RH7 RPMs and tarballs, as well as the Deb6 and Deb7 RPM and tarball, and the SL7 tarball, which I claim means I kludged in the packaging OK. I should have the default change in on the branch by the end of the day, at which point somebody could review the patch (TimT?). We wanted to do some production testing..

CODE REVIEW: looks goods. However, modern Linuxes have GLOBAL_MAX_FDS over 32768 already. Script is correctly not setting this value.
